013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
018
019import java.net.*;
020import java.util.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025
026/**
027 * A single encoding definition applied to a single schema property.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * The Encoding Object is a single encoding definition applied to a single schema property. It allows you to define 
031 * how a property should be serialized when it's part of a request or response body with a specific media type.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
034 * <p>
035 * The Encoding Object is composed of the following fields:
036 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
037 *    <li><c>contentType</c> (string) - The Content-Type for encoding a specific property. Default value depends on the property type
038 *    <li><c>headers</c> (map of {@link HeaderInfo}) - A map allowing additional information to be provided as headers
039 *    <li><c>style</c> (string) - Describes how a specific property value will be serialized depending on its type
040 *    <li><c>explode</c> (boolean) - When this is true, property values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value
041 *    <li><c>allowReserved</c> (boolean) - Determines whether the parameter value should allow reserved characters
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
045 * <p class='bcode'>
046 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
047 *    Encoding <jv>x</jv> = <jsm>encoding</jsm>()
048 *       .setContentType(<js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>)
049 *       .setStyle(<js>"form"</js>)
050 *       .setExplode(<jk>true</jk>);
051 *
052 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
053 *    String <jv>json</jv> = Json.<jsm>from</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>);
054 *
055 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
056 *    <jv>json</jv> = <jv>x</jv>.toString();
057 * </p>
058 * <p class='bcode'>
059 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
060 *    {
061 *       <js>"contentType"</js>: <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>,
062 *       <js>"style"</js>: <js>"form"</js>,
063 *       <js>"explode"</js>: <jk>true</jk>
064 *    }
065 * </p>
066 *
067 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
068 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#encoding-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; Encoding Object</a>
069 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/describing-request-body/">OpenAPI Describing Request Body</a>
070 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi3</a>
071 * </ul>
072 */
073@FluentSetters
074public class Encoding extends OpenApiElement{
075
076   private String contentType,
077         style;
078   private Map<String,HeaderInfo> headers;
079   private Boolean explode,
080         allowReserved;
081
082   /**
083    * Default constructor.
084    */
085   public Encoding() { }
086
087   /**
088    * Copy constructor.
089    *
090    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
091    */
092   public Encoding(Encoding copyFrom) {
093      super(copyFrom);
094
095      this.contentType = copyFrom.contentType;
096      this.style = copyFrom.style;
097      this.explode = copyFrom.explode;
098      this.allowReserved = copyFrom.allowReserved;
099      this.headers = copyOf(copyFrom.headers, HeaderInfo::copy);
100   }
101
102   /**
103    * Make a deep copy of this object.
104    *
105    * @return A deep copy of this object.
106    */
107   public Encoding copy() {
108      return new Encoding(this);
109   }
110
111   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
112   protected Encoding strict() {
113      super.strict();
114      return this;
115   }
116
117   @Override /* GENERATED - do not modify */
118   public Encoding strict(Object value) {
119      super.strict(value);
120      return this;
121   }
122
123   /**
124    * Bean property getter:  <property>contentType</property>.
125    *
126    * <p>
127    * The URL pointing to the contact information.
128    *
129    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
130    */
131   public String getContentType() {
132      return contentType;
133   }
134
135   /**
136    * Bean property setter:  <property>url</property>.
137    *
138    * <p>
139    * The value can be of any of the following types: {@link URI}, {@link URL}, {@link String}.
140    * <br>Strings must be valid URIs.
141    *
142    * <p>
143    * URIs defined by {@link UriResolver} can be used for values.
144    *
145    * @param value
146    *    The new value for this property.
147    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
148    * @return This object
149    */
150   public Encoding setContentType(String value) {
151      contentType = value;
152      return this;
153   }
154
155   /**
156    * Bean property getter:  <property>style</property>.
157    *
158    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
159    */
160   public String getStyle() {
161      return style;
162   }
163
164   /**
165    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.
166    *
167    * @param value
168    *    The new value for this property.
169    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
170    * @return This object
171    */
172   public Encoding setStyle(String value) {
173      style = value;
174      return this;
175   }
176
177   /**
178    * Bean property getter:  <property>variables</property>.
179    *
180    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
181    */
182   public Map<String, HeaderInfo> getHeaders() {
183      return headers;
184   }
185
186   /**
187    * Bean property setter:  <property>variables</property>.
188    *
189    * @param value
190    *    The new value for this property.
191    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
192    * @return This object
193    */
194   public Encoding setHeaders(Map<String, HeaderInfo> value) {
195      headers = copyOf(value);
196      return this;
197   }
198
199   /**
200    * Adds one or more values to the <property>headers</property> property.
201    *
202    * @param key The mapping key.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
203    * @param value
204    *    The values to add to this property.
205    *    <br>Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
206    * @return This object
207    */
208   public Encoding addHeader(String key, HeaderInfo value) {
209      assertArgNotNull("key", key);
210      assertArgNotNull("value", value);
211      headers = mapBuilder(headers).sparse().add(key, value).build();
212      return this;
213   }
214
215   /**
216    * Bean property getter:  <property>required</property>.
217    *
218    * <p>
219    * The type of the object.
220    *
221    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
222    */
223   public Boolean getExplode() {
224      return explode;
225   }
226
227   /**
228    * Bean property setter:  <property>explode</property>.
229    *
230    * <p>
231    * The type of the object.
232    *
233    * @param value
234    *    The new value for this property.
235    *    <br>Property value is required.
236    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
237    * @return This object
238    */
239   public Encoding setExplode(Boolean value) {
240      explode = value;
241      return this;
242   }
243
244   /**
245    * Bean property getter:  <property>required</property>.
246    *
247    * <p>
248    * The type of the object.
249    *
250    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
251    */
252   public Boolean getAllowReserved() {
253      return allowReserved;
254   }
255
256   /**
257    * Bean property setter:  <property>explode</property>.
258    *
259    * <p>
260    * The type of the object.
261    *
262    * @param value
263    *    The new value for this property.
264    *    <br>Property value is required.
265    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
266    * @return This object
267    */
268   public Encoding setAllowReserved(Boolean value) {
269      allowReserved = value;
270      return this;
271   }
272
273   // <FluentSetters>
274
275   // </FluentSetters>
276
277   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
278   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
279      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
280      return switch (property) {
281         case "contentType" -> toType(getContentType(), type);
282         case "style" -> toType(getStyle(), type);
283         case "headers" -> toType(getHeaders(), type);
284         case "explode" -> toType(getExplode(), type);
285         case "allowReserved" -> toType(getAllowReserved(), type);
286         default -> super.get(property, type);
287      };
288   }
289
290   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
291   public Encoding set(String property, Object value) {
292      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
293      return switch (property) {
294         case "allowReserved" -> setAllowReserved(toBoolean(value));
295         case "contentType" -> setContentType(Utils.s(value));
296         case "explode" -> setExplode(toBoolean(value));
297         case "headers" -> setHeaders(mapBuilder(String.class, HeaderInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
298         case "style" -> setStyle(Utils.s(value));
299         default -> {
300            super.set(property, value);
301            yield this;
302         }
303      };
304   }
305
306   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
307   public Set<String> keySet() {
308      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
309         .addIf(allowReserved != null, "allowReserved")
310         .addIf(contentType != null, "contentType")
311         .addIf(explode != null, "explode")
312         .addIf(headers != null, "headers")
313         .addIf(style != null, "style")
314         .build();
315      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
316   }
317}
